title: How powerful is Olaf Lore wise?
body: I know about his prophecy that he will die from old age and that he tossed himself into battle with monsters and he beat them all, but how POWERFUL is he compared to other champs?

In reality he's an old champ with an old model and old kit.  So he's kinda over due for a VGU... including lore, personality, and looks.    

Personally, I'd love to see him as part of the Ursine.  A spiritwalker connected to the Volibear and as a stormborn (lightning born?,  Stormchild?)  --basically integrate lighting and his status as berserker more into his kit, personality, lore, and model.   I'm not on that project-- and it's not even slated yet (at least to my knowledge.)   So just my 2 cents.

Wait... if we make {{champion:2}} this supposed '_Stormborn Ursine_'. Can we still get another Ursine champ that's half bear-half man (_perhaps their kit could revolve around becoming more bear like over the course of the game_)? Or do we only get one Ursine champ? 

Also Olaf's destiny to die a ~~peaceful~~ coward's death should be kept, or at least make sure he eventually learns about it later on (_kinda like how we potentially can still see {{champion:98}} protecting Noxus at some point_). Also Lokfar should be kept in his origins, Lokfar... it just sounds nice to say, Lokar.

As many of the others replies have stated, I would be very grateful if Olaf's overall personality and tone remained similar to his appearance in the Shadow and Fortune short story (side note: one of my favorite league stories)

He is a prime example of light-heartedness in the League Universe without being too over the top (*cough IvernRakanZoe *cough). I would even argue that he is the star of Shadow and Fortune even though he's just a side character. He's easily the most memorable character in that story.

Maybe a compromise would be to have him be so focused on having a warrior's death that he becomes ursine in order to become closer to war and cheat his prophesied peaceful passing? Perhaps have it happen after the events of Shadow and Fortune so that story remains canon?

Anyway I'm just rambling, keep up the good work!
